column1: If an artery becomes blocked, it can lead to heart attack or stroke.
CHD is also called coronary artery disease (CAD).
A blocked artery can cause a heart attack.
High blood pressure and CAD are common causes of heart failure.
Heart valve diseases occur when one of the four valves in the heart doesn't work properly.
An unusual heartbeat, called a heart murmur, is the most common symptom.
Certain heart problems, such as heart attack, heart disease, or infection, can cause heart valve diseases.
High blood pressure (hypertension) is a cardiovascular disease that can lead to other problems, such as heart attack, heart failure, and stroke.
This can happen because of a blood clot traveling to the blood vessels in the brain, or bleeding in the brain.
